TITLE: Inflation is dominating the conversation on earnings calls. Here's what execs are saying
SUMMARY: One thing is clear at the start of the corporate earnings season: Inflation remains a hot topic for company executives.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan CEOs tip U.S. economy for recession as labor tightness keeps Fed aggressive
SUMMARY: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon and JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon both expect a U.S. recession.

TITLE: U.S. GDP accelerated at 2.6% pace in Q3, better than expected as growth turns positive
SUMMARY: Gross domestic product was expected to grow at a 2.3% annualized pace in the third quarter, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: Powell again is facing political pressure as worries mount over the economy
SUMMARY: No stranger to political pressure, the Fed chief this week found himself the focus of concern in a letter from Democratic Sen. Sherrod Brown.

TITLE: Key inflation gauge for the Fed rose 0.5% in September, in line with expectations
SUMMARY: The core personal consumption expenditures price index increased 0.5% from the previous month and accelerated 5.1% over the past 12 months.

TITLE: U.S. economy seeing a 'mitigation' in growth not a slowdown, says Bank of America CEO
SUMMARY: Consumers and corporations have strong underlying credit and are not holding back, Brian Moynihan said.

TITLE: U.S. consumer spending seeing a 'mitigation' in growth not a slowdown, says Bank of America CEO
SUMMARY: Consumers and corporations have strong underlying credit and are not holding back, Brian Moynihan said.

TITLE: Private payrolls rose 239,000 in October, better than expected, while wages increased 7.7%, ADP says
SUMMARY: Companies added 239,000 positions in October, ahead of the Dow Jones estimate of 195,000, ADP reported Wednesday.

TITLE: Job openings surged in September despite Fed efforts to cool labor market
SUMMARY: Employment openings for the month totaled 10.72 million, well above the FactSet estimate of 9.85 million.

TITLE: Labor costs show slower rise, while trade deficit widens and jobless claims nudge lower
SUMMARY: The cost of labor rose less than expected, but low productivity helped keep pressure on inflation in the third quarter.

TITLE: U.S. payrolls surged by 261,000 in October, better than expected as hiring remains strong
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 205,000 in October, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: The unemployment rate for Black men fell in October, but so did labor force participation
SUMMARY: Workers of color continue to see higher rates of unemployment than their white counterparts.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs are for October 2022 â€” in one chart
SUMMARY: The health-care and manufacturing sectors added notable gains.
